summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Health Services Clinical Encounter form documenting an injury assessment for inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein on July 23, 2019. The report details that Epstein was found in his cell with a rope around his neck, resulting in marks, and was subsequently placed on suicide watch. The inmate claimed not to know how the injury occurred.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the medical encounter report, found in his cell with a rope around his neck, assessed for injuries and placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Operational Lt.
persons.context: Requested the injury report for inmate Epstein. The title is mentioned but the individual's full name is not provided.

events.title: Epstein Found with Neck Injury in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell (Special Housing Unit Z05-Cell 124 L) with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor. He was assessed by medical staff, showed a circular line of erythema on his neck, and was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Medical Assessment and Suicide Watch Placement
events.description: A clinical encounter was performed at the Bureau of Prisons Health Services. Epstein was assessed, found to have injuries consistent with self-infliction, and formally placed on suicide watch with a follow-up plan.

locations: Bureau of Prisons - NYM (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his prison cell with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor.
Epstein told medical staff he did not know how the injury occurred, stating 'I do not know. Just went to drink a little water and wake up snorting' and could not explain the marks on his neck.

The medical assessment noted a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of his neck, approximately 2 inches wide, covering about two-thirds of the neck circumference, with signs of friction in the front.
Based on information from custody staff and the clinical findings, the injury was assessed as 'self inflicted' and Epstein was placed on suicide watch.
The document records that Epstein was 'smiling during this clinical encounter' and denied being in any pain or distress, despite the visible injury.
